```{r }
#| label: tbl-schedule
#| echo: false
#| eval: true
#| tbl-cap: "Tentative schedule"
#| tbl-subcap:
#|   - "Monday 8 May, 2023"
#|   - "Monday 8 May, 2023"
#|   - "Tuesday 9 May, 2023"
#|   - "Wednesday 10 May, 2023"
#|   - "Thursday 11 May, 2023"
#|   - "Friday 12 May, 2023"
library(knitr)
schedule <- read.table("schedule.tsv", sep="\t", header=TRUE, fill=TRUE)
colnames(schedule)[5] <- "Lecturer / TA"
days <- c("Monday", "Monday (alt)", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday")
i <- unlist(lapply(days, function(x) {grep(x, schedule$Day)}))
j <- c(i[2:length(i)], nrow(schedule) + 1) - i
schedule$split <- factor(rep(days, j), levels=days)
splitschedule <- split(schedule, schedule$split)
outcols <- c("Time", "Topic", "Lecturer / TA", "Type")
# Manually write kables
kable(splitschedule$Monday[, outcols], row.names=FALSE)
kable(splitschedule[["Monday (alt)"]][, outcols], row.names=FALSE)
kable(splitschedule$Tuesday[, outcols], row.names=FALSE)
kable(splitschedule$Wednesday[, outcols], row.names=FALSE)
kable(splitschedule$Thursday[, outcols], row.names=FALSE)
kable(splitschedule$Friday[, outcols], row.names=FALSE)
```
